title: News View :: The World On Arirang
text: A Japanese media outlet is reporting that it's unlikely there'll be summit next month between President Moon Jae-in and Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe despite the friendly letter Moon sent Abe expressing the need for such talks.A report Wednesday in the Yomiuri Shimbun said that when the Japanese PM received the letter he asked that South Korea create an opportunity to improve relations.And according to the paper, a high ranking official said the ball is now in Seoul's court.Moon sent the letter to Abe via South Korean Prime Minister Lee Nak-yon who visited Japan this month for the enthronement of Emperor Naruhito.
description: 한국을 대표하는 글로벌 방송! The World On Arirang!
